body:
This PR makes the following changes to the `py-torch` package:

- [x] Add PyTorch 1.9.0, https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v1.9.0
- [x] Deprecate PyTorch 0.X and 1.4.0
- [x] Don't use vendored third-party libraries when possible
- [x] Add the following variants: kineto, metal, numa, numpy, valgrind, mpi, tensorpipe, onnx_ml
- [x] Remove the following variants: test, miopen, opencv, ffmpeg, leveldb, lmdb, binary, redis, zstd, tbb
- [x] Use same variant defaults as CMake
- [x] Add conflicts for many variants
- [x] pthread_np patch no longer needed in 1.9+, https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/55063 has been merged

I tested all versions of this package with the default variants on Ubuntu 18.04 with Python 3.8.10/3.7.10 and GCC 7.5.0:

- [x] master
- [x] 1.9.0
- [x] 1.8.1
- [x] 1.7.1
- [x] 1.6.0
- [x] 1.5.1
- [x] 1.4.1
- [x] 1.3.1
- [x] 1.2.0
- [x] 1.1.0
- [x] 1.0.1

Closes #20810 @rblake-llnl 
Closes #14518 @coreyjadams @eugeneswalker
title: Overhaul PyTorch package
